alert.note: Alert for McDowell; Mingo; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 3:52PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern McDowell, southeastern Mingo and southwestern Wyoming Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 351 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Welch, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hanover, Gilbert Creek, Davy, Iaeger, Avondale, Wolf Pen and Baileysville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
